definition: karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: Will donate money to, the brain will be fresh interest to study before karma.
sentences.chinese: 有钱要会布施，脑中才会清爽息念，才会消业障。

sentences.english: If you’ve failed before, think about what obstacle stopped you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾经遭遇失败，想想是什么业障阻碍了你。

sentences.english: The most direct method to eliminate karmic hindrances is through making full prostrations.
sentences.chinese: 消除业障最直接的方法就是拜忏。

sentences.english: Thanks to those who have lashed me because they cleared my way.
sentences.chinese: 感谢鞭打过我的人，因为他消除了我的业障。

sentences.english: It is recommended that you start from repenting of bad karma and make repentance prostrations every day.
sentences.chinese: 建议你先从忏悔业障开始起修，每天拜忏。

definition: to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
to pray to Buddha/to chant the names of Buddha
to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
sin (in Buddhism)/enmity leading to sin/also written 冤孽
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
variant of 磨難|磨难[mo2 nan4]
to give food (as a charity)/"feeding the hungry ghosts" (Buddhist ceremony)
